definition: grandiose but impractical (idiom)/large but of no real use
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: But ponderous attempts to keep control may dampen the Olympic mood.
sentences.chinese: 不过，如此大而无当的控制只会败坏了奥运气氛。

sentences.english: I had never been close to Grandiose Project.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没有接近大而无当项目。

definition: empty cave, nothing there (idiom); devoid of substance/nothing new to show
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
high sounding and impractical/high flown nonsense
flower but no fruit (idiom); handsome exterior but hollow inside/flashy
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
